title: Australia's Social Media Ban: Your Questions Answered | 9 News Australia
description: Australia's world-leading social media ban for under-16s comes into effect this week, but parents and young Aussies still have plenty of questions - so we took them to the people in charge. | Subscribe and ðŸ””: http://9Soci.al/KM6e50GjSK9 | Get more breaking news at 9News.com.au: http://9Soci.al/iyCO50GjSK6  FOLLOW 9News Australia â–º Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/9News/ â–º Twitter: https://twitter.com/9NewsAUS â–º Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/9news/  Join 9News for the latest in news and events that affect you in your local city, as well as news from across Australia and the world.  #BREAKINGNEWS #9NEWS #AUSTRALIA   Chapters: 00:00 Introduction: A World First in Australia 00:12 The Government's Position & Public Debate 00:28 Is it the Government's Place to Tell Parents How to Raise Children? 01:15 Which Platforms Are In and Which Are Out of the Ban? 01:55 Why is Discord excluded from the ban? 02:39 YouTube's Non-Account Access & Targeted Advertising 03:30 Why isn't age verification needed for adult websites (pornography) and AI chatbots? 04:45 Data Security and Privacy Concerns 05:45 Age Assurance Technology: Are the Commissioner's Discussions Satisfactory? 06:20 Why a Ban on Platforms, Not Just Harmful Content? 09:25 Other Tools to Combat Harmful Content 10:02 YouTube's Harmful Content Problem 14:46 Upcoming Rules for Search Engines and AI Chatbots 16:26 The Technology Underpinning the Ban 18:44 The VPN and Circumvention Issue 21:39 Parental Responsibility & Penalty 22:47 Reporting Loopholes and Underage Users 25:55 Support for Teachers and Parents

title: 9News Sydney | Monday December 8 | Full Episode
description: Georgie Gardner leads the bulletin with major news, including tragedy on the NSW coastline as a veteran firefighter is killed battling bushfires. Federal cost-of-living relief ends, hitting Australian households, just as Barnaby Joyce causes a political sensation by defecting to One Nation. We also cover the guilty verdict in the high-profile Toyah Cordingley murder case, the Wests Tigers internal chaos, and a crackdown on hate crime.
